availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Bracken L. Davis (Johnson County, farmer and soldier)

body.p: Johnson County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of Elias Davis and Anna Curtis Davis. Married to Mary Canly Davis on November 18, 1856. Father of Elexiar Davis, Lusira Davis, and James Davis. Resident in Johnson County in 1850. Farmer in Johnson County in 1860. Served in the 65th Regiment of Kentucky Militia as corporal from May 21, 1864 to June 21, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Johnson County, p. 90B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Johnson County, p. 48.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Johnson County, Paintsville, p. 18.
Marriage Records: Kentucky Marriages, (Richmond, KY: Madison County Courthouse), film no. 001912950, p. 29.
Kentucky Death Records on Microfilm (1852-1910), KDLA, Roll #7017468, All Counties, p. 774.
